title: I do respect the skill of pro players
body: But god damn I get annoyed when I see these circlejerky "X with epic outplay on X" videos then you watch it and sure it's an outplay but it's nothing amazing, idk just annoying to see all these overly hyped "Plays" videos.

replies.body: Pros play against people of skill relative to their own, just like bronze v bronze, so I don't think it is much more impressive if a pro outplays another pro.

pretty much this, unless its like a laughable outplay where you just know people shouldn't be in the LCS, faker stealing baron with xeraths e at worlds, like im bronze and i can smite baron properly..

> [{quoted}](name=Wiggy,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=azZ66hkE,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-02-04T17:09:08.738+0000)
>
> pretty much this, unless its like a laughable outplay where you just know people shouldn't be in the LCS, faker stealing baron with xeraths e at worlds, like im bronze and i can smite baron properly..

I stole Baron with Yasuo 3rd q no sight was on Ranked 5s and they didn't kill scuttles XD wish I had been recording :(

the other week i stole dragon with janna Q. max range Q knocked up the jungler so he couldnt smite and the damage was enough that it finished dragon off. better yet it was dragon 5 for my team, so we won a 4 vs 5 with the amped damage.

I stole baron with a blind thresh q. The rest of my team was already dead and the enemy was a full team of five with a nasus. I got away safely with baron. But they still finished the game in the next minute. :C

what about faker on zed, diving into baron pit and killing enemy jungler kha so fast that he also took baron on the way out with Q?
all the casters watching the play were like "oh he cant do anything here 5 vs 1" then kha took 2 shots from baron and he was low enough for just one quick combo.
